articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: But the strong winds that fanned the flames were expected to pick up again today, worsening conditions.
articles.title: Los Angeles firefighters see progress in containing blazes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, whose nearly 12 years in office have been marked by a deep economic and social crisis, is set to be sworn in for a third term on Friday, staying in power despite a six-month-long dispute over a July election and international calls for him to stand aside.
articles.title: Venezuela's Maduro to be sworn in for third term as opposition leader vows to return

articles.author: Timothy Gardner, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: The Biden administration on Friday imposed its broadest package of sanctions yet targeting Russia's oil and gas revenues in an attempt to give Kyiv and the incoming administration of Donald Trump leverage to reach a deal for peace in Ukraine.
articles.title: Biden hits Russian oil in toughest sanctions yet in bid to give Ukraine, Trump leverage

articles.author: Jacob Gronholt-Pedersen, Stine Jacobsen
articles.description: Denmark's government has proposed purchasing two new Arctic inspection vessels and increasing dog sled patrols to boost its military presence in Greenland, as U.S. President-elect Donald Trump sets his sights on the island, local media reported.
articles.title: Denmark plans new ships, dog sled patrols in Greenland as Trump seeks control

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Lili Bayer
articles.description: NATO won't heed Donald Trump’s proposal for a massive hike in defence spending but will likely agree to go beyond its current target, according to officials and analysts.
articles.title: NATO won't back Trump's new defence spending target but will raise its sights

articles.author: Kate Abnett, Alison Withers
articles.description: As the death toll climbed from wildfires raging in California, scientists confirmed on Friday that the world has just experienced the first year in which temperatures exceeded 1.5C above pre-industrial times.
articles.title: 2024 was the first year above 1.5C of global warming, scientists say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel confirmed on Friday that a hostage found killed in Gaza was Hamza Ziyadne, the son of deceased hostage Youssef Ziyadne, whose body was found alongside him in an underground tunnel near the southern city of Rafah.
articles.title: Israeli military names hostage killed alongside father in Gaza
Lebanon's Mikati to meet Syrian leader Sharaa in Damascus, Lebanese sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least three women were killed and five children injured in a stampede in the landmark Umayyad Mosque in Damascus on Friday, the Syrian civil defence said.
articles.title: Stampede kills three women, injures five children in Umayyad Mosque in Damascus

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexico is going to find a solution to avoid the application of tariffs from the United States, Economy Minister Marcelo Ebrard said on Friday, following threats from U.S. President-elect Donald Trump to do so.
articles.title: Mexico going to find a way to avoid US tariffs, minister says
